info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 4:23AM MST until January 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM SATURDAY TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, except 6 to 12 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning, moderate to heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches, except 8 to 14 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Southern Hills/Albion Mountains and Raft River Region, including but not limited to Albion, Almo, Malta, Rockland, and Holbrook. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 5 AM MST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 AM Saturday to 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing and drifting snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commute.
info.instruction: For the Blizzard Warning, travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the Winter Storm Warning, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting 511.idaho.gov.
